ygData.subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Hunting Guide?
ygData.msgSnippet: Najena was pretty good solo, same with Unrest, even though it was a pain breaking up the undead from the others.  Forget guk or everfrost, second you really
ygData.messageBody:
Najena was pretty good solo, same with Unrest, even though it was a pain
breaking up the undead from the others. Forget guk or everfrost, second you
really beat something up, it runs and gets more. That is why I liked
unrest, the dead didn't run as much. Also gonna try Mistmoore Sooner or
later but I have never been there. Birds in SK if you don't mind the crowd.
I soloed a bit in Rathe Mnts, but I decided to hold that off till I was a
little higher level. Anyway, that was my two cents :)

Sister Shelza, Karana

>From: "Currey, Mick" <mick_currey@...>
>Reply-To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
>To: "'EQ-Monks@onelist.com'" <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
>Subject: [EQ-Monks] Hunting Guide?
>Date: Wed, 8 Mar 2000 09:07:20 -0600
>
>Hail all you experienced monks out there.
>
>What recommendations does everyone have for places to hunt solo by levels?
>
>My character is only level 21, but here were his favorites so far>
>
>Level Area Hunted
>1-4 Freeport
>5-10 Rivervale (with runnyeye bead quest)
>11-12 Black Burrow (with gnoll teeth quest)
>13-16 Wisp island (gls quest, good money and exp!)
>17-18 EK (gnoll reavers)
>19-20 HH (gnolls solo and orcs in a group)
>21-22? Gorge hunting mino's
>22+? Not there yet............1 bubble to go!
>
>The quests seem to really speed up the leveling. Has anyone else found
>that
>to be true also? Are they any good quests out there for experience once in
>the twenties and beyond?
>
>Thanks,
>
>Thors Blazingfury, Level 21, Tunare
>
>
>
>
